p: Further evidence confirmed overlap of COVID-19 patients with renal dysfunction. In two hospitals in Wuhan, 59% of patients with COVID-19 had proteinuria, 44% had hematuria, 14% had increased BUN levels, and 10% had increased serum creatinine [24]â€”data that were validated in another hospital [33]. Individuals who developed AKI had a 5.3 times higher mortality risk than those without AKI, higher than that of comorbid chronic illness (1.5 times more) [24]. Clinical evidence from Shanghai revealed that ICU patients were more likely to have increased creatinine (15.8% vs 4.1%) and BUN (26.3% vs 5.7%) [41].
